meanings.definition: To give birth to; to bring forth
meanings.sent1: The cat birthed four kittens yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird birthed her eggs in the nest.
meanings.sent3: The garden birthed a surprise pumpkin patch overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity birthed a masterpiece that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The volcano birthed a river of lava, painting the landscape in fiery hues.

meanings.sent1: The artist birthed a beautiful painting from her imagination.
meanings.sent2: The inventor birthed a new gadget that revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent3: The chef birthed a delicious recipe that became an instant hit.
meanings.sent4: His passion birthed a movement that inspired change in society.
meanings.sent5: The writer birthed a captivating story that held readers spellbound.

meanings.definition: To be born; to come into existence
meanings.sent1: The idea birthed in his mind slowly took shape.
meanings.sent2: The universe birthed galaxies and stars in its vast expanse.
meanings.sent3: The friendship birthed between them was unexpected but cherished.
meanings.sent4: From the chaos, order birthed, bringing harmony to the world.
meanings.sent5: The dream birthed in her heart guided her towards her true calling.
